pull_requests.title: BIP3: Address additional review
pull_requests.body:
BIP3 got a bit more review from @RubenSomsen, @darosior, and @jonatack. Thanks!

This PR addresses the review. Most of it related to minor phrasing improvements, typos, and added emphasis.

I also added mention of the Version header and Changelog to the Backward Compatibility section which I had overlooked, and explain why I consider the headers "Superseded-by" and "Replaces" asymmetric, and only propose a new name for "Superseded-by" but retain "Replaces".

**This PR includes a deletion and readdition of the entire BIP‚ÄØ3, so as to provide further reviewers a surface to leave [comments directly on the BIP text](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1819/commits/3ec810e7c483a3896ce3221e9da2920306736251).** These two commits will disappear without a trace when the PR is later squash-merged.

comment_list.body: Happy with the changes. I'm fully behind BIP3. Good work, Murchüëç

What is the advantage of changing the diagram to a white background? That change makes it more disagreeable to read when using GitHub in dark mode; same for use in a presentation with a dark background (as I did a few days ago).

![2025-04-12 BIP statuses](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c1e658d9-f33c-4a05-a655-6910e3fae7eb)

I think this "standard-track" footnote is confusing and could made clearer. Maybe we can do a call to discuss: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1819/files#diff-0fe6969eba0422ddb0e7823d13092c03aa90122e0c5e66786c5d8b20f54719e6R625
Rebased on the latest `master` branch to mitigate conflicts in follow-up #1820.
Thanks for the review, @jonatack, @RubenSomsen @real-or-random, @ajtowns, and @darosior. Let‚Äôs see if there is more review until the end of this week, otherwise I think this is ready for merge.

pull_requests.title: chore: update string formatting to f-strings
pull_requests.body:
updated the code to replace the old-style string formatting with f-strings for better readability and consistency. For example, this:

```python
raise ValueError('aux_rand must be 32 bytes instead of %i.' % len(aux_rand))
```

has been changed to:

```python
raise ValueError(f'aux_rand must be 32 bytes instead of {len(aux_rand)}.')
```

Similarly, all instances of old-style formatting, such as:

```python
print(' * Signing test raised exception:', e)
```

have been updated to:

```python
print(f' * Signing test raised exception: {e}')
```
